attributes.action: Remove the Manchester clean air zones it is the opposite to what was voted for.
attributes.additional_details:
As this is directly opposite to what Manchester voted for in a referendum these plans should be automatically cancelled.
These plans should not be considered unless Manchester is given a new referendum and this wins by a significant amount.
This is simply we will tax on the working class who cant afford new cars.
attributes.background:
Greater Manchester Clean Air Plan proposals will introduce a daily fee for non-compliant vehicles entering the proposed Clean Air Zone. The following indicative daily penalties are estimates for the proposals. 
This is contrary to the referendum Manchester voted in

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. Decisions about local clean air zones are a matter for the relevant local authorities, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local authority directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://democracy.manchester.gov.uk/mgEPetitionListDisplay.aspx
